newsitem.title: VENEZUELA: Quake shakes Venezuela coast, no injuries reported.
newsitem.headline: Quake shakes Venezuela coast, no injuries reported.

text.p: A strong earthquake measuring 5.5 on the open-ended Richter scale shook most of Venezuela's central and eastern coastal region on Wednesday but there were no reports of injuries, local radio reported.
The quake shook office buildings in downtown Caracas but apparently caused no structural damage. Residents made anxious calls to radio stations.
The U.S. Geological Survey in Golden, Colorado, said the quake measured 6.9 on the Richter scale.

Telephone lines to the Venezuelan seismological institute FUVISIS were busy. Radio reports said the institute had placed the epicentre of the quake about 30 miles off Venezuela's eastern Caribbean coast.
